# Thermal Analysis Laboratory Renewal - Advance Contract Award Notice

## Overview
The National Research Council Canada has posted an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) to replace existing thermal analysis equipment in their laboratory. The council intends to award the contract to a qualified bidder, pending final price and other considerations.

### Contract Details

* Tender Reference Number: cb-8682-53509358
* Solicitation Number: 23-58092
* Publication Date: August 31, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: September 15, 2024, 2:00 PM EDT
* Expected Contract Start Date: September 22, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: February 28, 2024

### Contract Description
The Construction Research Center of the National Research Council Canada requires a contract to replace one non-functioning Modulated Differential Scanning Calorimeter (MDSC) and one non-functioning Thermal Gravimetric Analyzer (TGA) in their Thermal Analysis Laboratory.

### Tender Information
* UNSPSC Code: 41100000 - Laboratory and Scientific Equipment
* Trade Agreements: Various, including Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA) and Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of Opportunity: National Capital Region (NCR)
* Regions of Delivery: Canada

### Bidding Details
The tender was published with an amendment number of one. The procurement category is Government to Government (GD), and the notice type is an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN).

### Contact Information
For more information on this tender, please contact Stéhane Lajoie via email at [stephane.lajoie@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:stephane.lajoie@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca) or by phone at (514) 210-7395.

### Tenders Documents
Please find the tender notice and supporting documents at the following links:

* English: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/8682/23-58092_acan_thermalanalysislaboratoryrenewal.pdf
* French: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/8682/23-58092_pac_renouvellementdulaboratoireanalysethermique.pdf

Please note that this tender is no longer accepting bids, as it has expired. The National Research Council Canada has already awarded the contract.
